results.title: The Bulk Link
results.creator_credit: Scope Films and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: The ‘bulk-link’ is the vital bridge from the harvest field to the shipping port- the bulk grain handlers. New techniques in the field, the central storage facilities at the embarkation port have made the bulk link a more economical and efficient process. Photography: Edwin Scragg.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Scope Films and South Australian Film Corporation

results.title: The Buildings already begun
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Guy Glover and Bill Pettigrew
results.brief_description: Not everyone agreed that the buildings already begun were worth finishing, but, in spite of opposition, Canada built its imposing Houses of Parliament in Ottawa on the hill above the river. From a rich archive of pictures of the federal Parliament buildings as they developed over the past hundred years, this film creates a vivid sense of being there.

results.title: The Building of Florence Cathedral
results.creator_credit: British Broadcasting Corporation and Mary Hoskins
results.brief_description: Shows how, by examining works of art, it is possible to learn much about the society that produced them, with particular reference to the building of the Cathedral of Santa Maria del Fiore in renaissance Florence. Commentary by John Larner.
results.description: Shows how, by examining works of art, it is possible to learn much about the society that produced them, with particular reference to the building of the Cathedral of Santa Maria del Fiore in renaissance Florence. Commentary by John Larner.

results.title: The Building of Boulder Dam
results.creator_credit: Dowling and Brownell, International Harvester, Pat Dowling and Hobart Brownell
results.brief_description: Shows details of the building of the great structure that dammed the Colorado River forming an extensive lake. Varied activities, incidental to the building of the dam are woven into the story of the film.

results.title: The Builders
results.brief_description: A story without words of the construction of a building in Los Angeles, from the first truck taking excavated earth from the site to the last worker waxing the new floors.

results.title: The Builders
results.creator_credit: Australian National Film Board and James Fitzpatrick
results.brief_description: An outline is shown of the aid which Australia is giving to her neighbours in South-East Asia under the Colombo Plan. Assistance under the Colombo Plan is given to peoples of all nations and all creeds to help them become self-sufficient technically and economically. Narration by Don Crosbie.

results.title: The Bugs Bunny Road-runner movie
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures and Chuck Jones
results.brief_description: A feature length animated film starring everyone’s favourite rabbit, Bugs Bunny. Living in retirement in his carrot-filled mansion in Beverly Hills, Bugs takes us into his portrait gallery where we are introduced to many famous characters such as Daffy Duck, Porky Pig, Elmer Fudd, Pepe le Pew, Wile E. Coyote and Road-runner, and also some of the important people behind the animation scene including Mel Blanc and Tex Avery. The film is interspersed with excerpts from some of the most classic Chuck Jones cartoons including Duck Dodgers, Robin Hood Daffy, Duck Amuck, What’s Opera Doc? with Bugs as our host throughout the fun-filled chaotic adventures. The final twenty minutes of the film consists of a compilation of Road-runner cartoons edited down into one long manic cartoon chase, featuring of course, that old die-hard Wile E. Coyote and the ever elusive Road-runner. Character voices by Mel Blanc and Arthur Q. Bryan.

results.title: The Bugaku dance
results.brief_description: An introduction to “Bugaku” or Japanese Imperial Court dance and music, which have been preserved in the Imperial Court for centuries. It contains performances of “Ryoo”, a solo dance played with the use of masks, and “Bairo”, a mass dance. Music only - no narration.
